96.excerpt: A polished, flattering style, with a core of raspberry and cherry puree flavors that sail through easily, with light red licorice, vanilla and sandalwood notes chiming in on the finish. A crowd-pleaser. Drink now through 2025. 400 cases made.  –JM

Sonoma Coast Chardonnay.excerpt: This white opens in a rich, beautiful nose of creme brûlée, honeycomb and a light lift of pear, delving into a crisp core of complexity and structure midway through. Layered and well-balanced in oak, fruit and acidity, it is a gorgeous expression of the coast.

The 2018 Chardonnay Sonoma Coast spent 15 months in 30% new French oak. It's pure class, offering bright citrus and pineapple fruit as well as lots of white flowers, salty minerality, and just a touch of background oak. With racy acidity, beautiful purity and richness, and a big finish, this pure, balanced, awesome Sonoma Coast Chardonnay is going to keep for 10-15 years.

This wine has rounded edges of smooth opulence, making the case for full-bodied intensity and concentration expressed within layers of rich stone and tropical fruit. With hints of saline, it offers a contrast of sweet and savory, and is plenty fresh in the glass. VIRGINIE BOONE

Coming all from the Ritchie Vineyard (which is in the Russian River Valley) and aged 15 months in 30% new French oak, the 2015 Chardonnay Sonoma Coast is a rockstar! Buttered lemons, citrus, honeysuckle, poached pear, and some white flower notes all flow to a rich, powerful, beautifully concentrated Chardonnay that has some rock-solid mid-palate heft yet has vibrant acidity and purity. It's a beautiful, serious effort.

Quenching in crisp acidity while offering robustly opulent layers of pear and peach, this wine finds a happy balance through its undeniable richness, the oak well integrated and bursting in baking spice and vanilla bean. — Virginie Boone

Toasted oak and almond aromas lead to more toast, nuts and butter on the palate, which is not at all a bad thing for those who like a traditional California Chardonnay. A full body, rich texture and solid base of Bosc pear fruit are easy to enjoy.

The 2021 Domaine Della Sonoma Coast Chardonnay is lively and satisfying on the palate. This wine offers aromas and flavors of delicious golden apples, hints of stone fruits, and mineral notes. Enjoy it with pan-fried, panko-coated Petrale sole.
Nectarines, mangoes, orange curd, honeysuckle and salted caramel on the nose. Excellent concentration, with a full body and creamy, compact layers. I like the salty undertones. Drink now.
Attractive nose of toasted bread, burnt lemons, baked apples and buttered popcorn. It's full-bodied with a buttery, weighty palate. Toasty and tasty finish. Drink now.
Shows great intensity, with pineapple, guava and peach flavors at the core, plus hints of lemon zest, candied ginger and vibrant acidity on a dense frame. Drink now. 150 cases made.
Earthy and herbal, this coastal appellation wine is rich and thick in crème brûlée and tropical fruit, densely concentrated and lingering in toasted oak and baking spice. - Virginie Boone
Firm and restrained, with Honeycrisp apple, pear, pineapple and citrus zest notes on a juicy, sleek frame, showing hints of white flowers. Drink now. 150 cases made.  –MW

Russian River Valley Pinot Noir.excerpt: Brimming in strawberry, cola and a lightness of baking spice, this is a creamy and lush expression of the appellation, with complex layers of bright acidity. The lift and balance is accented in savory hints of black tea and clove.

The 2019 Pinot Noir Russian River Valley has more floral aromas, with sweet cedar, ripe raspberry, and baking spice. The palate has beautiful concentration and fresh fruit that surges through to a long finish with a tangerine note. Hold 1-2 years and drink over the following 8-10 years.

The 2019 Domaine Della Russian River Valley Pinot Noir is bright and alive with tremendous energy. This wine offers aromas and flavors of ripe red and blue fruits, with wild strawberries and dried earth hints. Try it with rosemary and garlic-infused, spit-roasted leg of lamb.

Readers looking for a textbook Russian River Pinot should check out the 2018 Pinot Noir Russian River Valley. Offering up a medium ruby hue as well as lots of spiced red fruits, cola, leafy herbs, and flowery incense, it's medium to full-bodied and has a wonderful sense of balance and purity, ripe tannins, and a great finish. It's a big wine (over 15% alcohol), yet it still comes across as light and graceful.

The nose of this wine displays generous raspberry and cola aromas. On the palate, waves of orange peel acidity are balanced by star anise, black cherry and tart plum flavors in a rich, but not heavy framework.

The 2021 Domaine Della Russian River Valley Pinot Noir is well-built and firm on the palate. This wine shows aromas and flavors of strawberries and blackberries with spice, oaky notes, and a hint of tannins. Try it with grilled lamb kebabs.

Fragrant in aroma and soft on the first sip, this charming wine firms up a bit on the palate, wrapping mild tannins and appetizing acidity around strawberries, red and black plums and hints of oak spice. It's well balanced and has a pure fruit expression.

This appellation wine delivers a lovely wall of spicy cherry and wild strawberry within a context of weighty tannin and girth. Substantially built in ripeness and richness, it offers lasting intensity with breadth and length. - Virginie Boone

Earthy rhubarb, black tea and cola combine effortlessly with a dense richness of wild strawberry in this full-bodied, well-structured and memorable wine. Bright acidity keeps it fresh and crisp in the glass as a long finish of additional baking spice lingers. — Virginie Boone

Ripe red/ruby-colored, the 2022 Pinot Noir Russian River Valley offers expressive notes of dried cherries, anise, fresh violets, lifted spices, and forest floor. Medium-bodied, it has a refined feel on the palate, with fine tannins and even, balanced acidity through to its floral and elegant finish. Drink 2025-2035.
Lovely nose with aromas of strawberries, raspberries, cranberries and mild spices. It’s medium-bodied with vivid acidity. Crunchy and fruit-driven with a succulent finish. Drink now.

Offers nice range, with racy damson plum and blood orange flavors joined by plumper mulberry and black cherry notes, all wrapped in a light potpourri and rose petal frame. Delivers a light apple wood accent that adds more energy to the juicy finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2031. 400 cases made.
Lots of crunchy cherries, bramble berries, sweet spices and hints of bark. Medium body with sleek tannins and fresh acidity. Juicy fruit with silky texture and a fruity, joyful finish. Drink now.

As we have often commented, it would not be wise to quickly dismiss any wine - and especially Pinot Noirs - that do not hail from a single vineyard site, and this well-made offering capably drives home the point. It is a precise and specific Pinot that is at once both rich and fairly lively with a fine backbone of balancing acidity working to brighten its nicely extracted mix of ripe cherry and berry fruit. It is both firm and slightly fleshy in feel, and, while its acidity accentuates its nominal back-end tannins, it is not so stiff or astringent as to dissuade near-term drinking, but it is a wine that we do see benefitting from three or four more years of cellaring.

The pale ruby-purple colored 2019 Pinot Noir Russian River Valley offers pretty scents of raspberry jam and violets, with touches of iron, dried herbs and Earl Grey tea leaves. The palate is light-bodied, silky, fresh and ultra-perfumed, finishing long and uplifted. It's a more delicate, red-fruited style than is typical of Russian River Valley. 400 cases produced.

The 2022 Domaine Della Russian River Valley Pinot Noir is definitive and complete on the palate. This wine shows aromas and flavors of spice box, a suggestion of sarsaparilla, and ripe strawberries. Try it with a delicately spiced lamb stew.
Friendly notes of cherry and damson plum offer a breezy edge, with tea and potpourri accents on the silky, easy finish. Drink now through 2026. 400 cases made.

Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir.excerpt: With a tart, tangy entry of crisp red and blue fruit, the wine is pillowy on the palate, with sublime texture and a lift of acidity. Lengthy, bright and lightly spiced, it offers a complete picture of this great coastal appellation.

Pale to medium ruby, the 2016 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast is youthfully subdued on the nose, opening to pomegranate, Bing cherry, warm red berries and pretty dried flowers with dusty earth, autumn leaves and spicy touches. Light to medium-bodied, it features wonderfully ripe, spicy red fruit in the mouth with soft, grainy tannins and lovely sweet spice on the finish. 225 cases produced.

Silky and powerfully built, this coastal wine is a celebration of richness, offering deep, dark notes of baked plum, dark cherry and black tea. Floral components of rose petal and earthy forest add to a weighty midpalate of chewy structure and intensity. - Virginie Boone

I loved the 2016 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast and this beauty has a terrific bouquet of wild strawberries, flowers, incense, and spice. It's elegant, medium to full-bodied, has a wonderful, seamless texture, and a great finish. Aged 15 months in 47% new French oak, it’s one classy Pinot Noir to enjoy over the coming decade or so.

One of the bigger, softer offerings from Domaine Della, this rich and full-bodied wine brings plum jam and strawberries to the nose and candied cherries to the palate. Its good viscosity and depth help build flavors in the mouth and let them linger on the finish.

The 2021 Domaine Della Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir is bright, attractive, and well-balanced. This wine excels with aromas and flavors of boysenberries, spicy notes, and hints of oak. Enjoy it with grilled lamb chops.

The 2019 Domaine Della Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir shows beautiful style, richness, and balance. This wine brings aromas and flavors of lively red and black fruit, with accents of licorice and dried earth. Pair it with grilled lamb chops.

Crisp red fruit, citrus and blueberry brighten a core of biting acidity in this coastal appellation wine, impressive in texture and length. Coated in cinnamon, nutmeg and black tea, it offers the best of the variety's fruit and savory components. - Virginie Boone

Bright cherry and raspberry liqueur aromas dominate the nose of this softly colored but intensely aromatic Pinot. The palate is saturated with brandy-soaked cherries, anise and sweet cinnamon flavors in a medium-bodied frame.
This juicy red is filled with fruity verve, showing dried raspberry flavors flanked by delicate floral accents. The minerally finish offers zesty acidity and hints of saffron. Drink now through 2024.

More framboise, spring flowers, candied violets, and strawberry notes emerge from the 2018 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast. It's medium to full-bodied, has a pretty, vibrant, edgy texture, good length, and is a richer, concentrated Sonoma Coast effort to enjoy over the coming 5-6 years.

The 2015 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast offers slightly more red fruits, bay leaf, and spice as well as a distinct salty minerality in its aromas and flavors. Silky, polished and elegant, with vibrant acidity, it's a harmonious, balanced, classic Pinot Noir that has rock-solid depth and richness.

The 2022 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast boasts a medium ruby color and is spicy and ripe with aromas of red berries, lifted spice, dusty earth, and wild herbs. Mid-weight and bright on the palate, it has zippy lift along with good ripeness and a clean, spicy finish. It’s a solid appellation wine to enjoy over the coming 5-6 years.

Fruity, juicy and fruit-driven, with raspberries, sour cherries, cranberries and mild spices on the nose. Medium-bodied with silky tannins and bright acidity. Succulent, with crunchy wild berry character on the palate and a flavorful finish with a peppery kick. Drink now.
Dark raspberries, cocoa, dried herbs and burnt oranges on the nose. Spicy and compact, with a medium to full body and subtly toasty layers. Fine and focused tannins. Drink now.

The 2022 Domaine Della Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir is well balanced and pleasing on the palate. This wine exhibits aromas and flavors of dried spices, chalk, and savory earth. Enjoy it with a grilled lamb and heirloom tomato sandwich.

Red fruit lasts through this wine’s potent oak char. Alex Mares of Eleven Madison Park described the fruit as “perfectly ripe, subtle with a sense of flowers and leaves.” The generosity of that fruit may well outlive the oak and its spice. For the cellar. (400 cases) —J.G.

Offers a red licorice note wrapped around plum and cherry flavors before ending with a fruitcake accent on the finish, showing a touch of brambly energy. A little shy on depth, though. Drink now through 2027. 400 cases made.

Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir.excerpt: Layered, gritty and grippy, this wine is defined by a savory earthiness that persists over ongoing acidity. Rose petal, rhubarb and baking spice accent an intensely built, well-structured and highly age-worthy expression of the variety from this appellation.

The 2022 Domaine Della Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir is an excellent wine with lasting depth on the palate. This wine excels with aromas and flavors of alluring sandalwood, tart blackberries, and rocks-in-the-desert. Invite your favorite wine buds and serve it with a garlic and rosemary-infused crown roast of lamb.

Potent aromas of dark cherry, star anise and oak-powered crème brûlée show on the nose of this appellation blend. A grippy texture frames the palate, where plum-skin and crushed berry flavors add an edge to the richer black-cherry and cardamom tones. - Matt Kettman

Elegantly rich aromas of boysenberry, black plum, mace and star anise are polished on the nose of this bottling. The palate lands with a fresh blast of strawberry and raspberry as cinnamon and peppery spices elevate the experience.
Inviting aromas of baked cherries, dried herbs and suede. Medium-to full-bodied with right and zippy acidity. Silky tannins are wrapped by sweet red fruit and white chocolate. Drink or hold.

Subtly elegant violet, lavender and rose petal aromas meet with a black-raspberry sorbet and hint of wood on the nose of this appellation blend. The floral tones of the palate surround dark-berry, earthy mushroom and wild mint flavors atop a taut texture that holds through the finish. — Matt Kettmann

Located south of Monterey, the Santa Lucia Highlands is a great AVA that produces an amazing amount of outstanding Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Syrahs. Starting with the appellation 2018 Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands, it comes all from the Soberanes Vineyard (in the relative center/southern end of the appellation) and spent 15 months in 47% new French oak. This beautiful, elegant, complex wine displays the fruit-loaded style of the appellation yet stays balanced, nicely textured, and even elegant. Black cherries, black raspberries, leafy herbs, a touch of flowers, and some earthy/forest floor notes all emerge from the glass, and it hits the palate with a soft, supple texture, again, terrific balance, and a great finish. It's slightly less expensive than the single vineyard, but I think it’s just as good.
Gentle aromas of blueberry, cranberry, lemon zest, violets, crushed gravel and chalk. It’s medium-to full-bodied with sleek, tight tannins and bright acidity. Focused and precise. Drink or hold.

A medium-bodied, fruity and crunchy pinot with notes of cranberries, red currants, wild strawberries and baking spices. Very juicy and playful. Fresh and succulent with a red currant-like finish. Drink or hold.

Alluring, with iris, blood orange and damson plum aromas and flavors that glide through. Shows nice cut on the lengthy finish, where an echo of hot stone lingers. Drink now through 2028. 150 cases made.  –JM

Deep and dark black cherry, caramel candy and gingerbread aromas make for a lush and intense nose on this single-vineyard expression, but it manages to also stay bright and zesty. The palate offers a similar range of flavors, from black-cherry compote to ginger snap cookies, proving quite satisfying. — Matt Kettmann

The 2021 Domaine Della is expressive with its purity and rustic style. This wine exhibits aromas and flavors of dried earth, spicy notes, and ripe berries. Enjoy it with pan-fried garlic and rosemary-infused lamb chops.
A medium-bodied red with sour cherries, redcurrants, forest berries and mild spices on the nose. Round and silky with a bright core of fruit and a succulent finish. Drink now.

\"Ritchie Vineyard\" RRV Chardonnay.excerpt: This wine hits every note, impressing in its cohesive grasp of balance and savory complexion. Baking spice and butter express themselves on the nose as a breadth of stone fruit, baked apple and pear present midpalate. Length, breadth and enduring freshness give it an undeniable imprint of excellence.

The vineyard designate, the 2018 Chardonnay Ritchie Vineyard is largely in the same mold, although it was brought up in slightly less new oak (25%) and is just a touch lower in alcohol and higher in acidity. Despite those technical details, it's richer and more opulent (which is why you shouldn't judge a wine by numbers) and offers beautiful stone fruits, toasted brioche, honeysuckle, and white flower aromas and flavors. As with the straight Sonoma, it's pure, medium to full-bodied, beautifully balanced, and has a great, great finish. This is another stunningly good Chardonnay from this estate to enjoy over the coming 7-8 years.

An outstanding white from a warm vintage, this shows rich layers of custard and lemon soufflé. Tangy tangerine and wet stone undertones give it lift and freshness as the richness returns for a full-throttled, creamy and cohesive finish. Virginie Boone

Aged 15 months in 25% new French oak, the 2017 Chardonnay Ritchie Vineyard isn't far off the 2016 in style yet has slightly vibrancy and sexy fruit. Lemon curd, salty sea breeze, white flowers, and some crushed rock notes all define this vibrant, pure, incredibly elegant Chardonnay that has bright acidity, good concentration, and a textured that just glides over the palate. It’s a brilliant Chardonnay to enjoy over the coming 7-8 years.

The nose of this wine is dominated by green apples and cinnamon, with intense freshness on the palate. Flavors of lemon and lime zest, Anjou pear and sweet baking spice mingle and swirl everywhere. The finish of the wine seems to be composed entirely of rays of sunshine. — Tom Capo

Aromas of spiced apples, baked pears, pastries, sweet spices and hints of baked lemons. It’s medium-bodied with fresh acidity. Delicious core of baked pears at the center with a caressing texture. Dense but agile, with a long, flavorful, vivid and focused finish. Drink or hold.

The 2021 Domaine Della Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay is alluring and demonstrative on the palate. This wine delivers aromas and flavors of sandalwood, earthy notes, ripe apples, and oak. Try it with baked halibut in a savory cream sauce.

Peaches, baked apples, hazelnuts, custard and some vanilla on the nose. It’s medium- to full-bodied, with deliciously toasty and flinty undertones to the fresh stone fruit. Vibrant acidity throughout, ending with a laser-focused and flavorful finish. Drink now or hold.

A long, delicious chardonnay with aromas of yellow flowers, toasted hazelnuts, peaches, French toast and nutmeg. It's full-bodied and creamy, yet remains agile and elegant. Fresh lemon-cream notes linger. Drink now.

The 2019 Domaine Della Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay is an excellent wine that stays long on the palate. This wine excels with aromas and flavors of savor spices, wild mushrooms, ripe fruit, and oak. Enjoy it with grilled shellfish in a savory, cream sauce.

This well-made, impressive wine from the great site opens with a smattering of coconut flake and rich lemon mouse. The full-bodied core consists of crisp green apple, tangerine and well-integrated acidity, leading the way to a brisk, fresh finish. - Virginie Boone

Mineral-laden earthiness underlies a richly textured and lengthy expression of ample tropical and stone fruit in this impressive vineyard designate. Baking spice and baked pear complete the cohesive picture of full-bodied power and grace. — Virginie Boone
Hawthorn, ripe-peach, spiced-apple and praline aromas. It’s full-bodied with crisp acidity. Concentrated and flavorful with a dense, phenolic texture. Long and tight. Drink or hold.

The 2018 Chardonnay Ritchie Vineyard has layered aromas of baked quince, yellow apples, lemon cream, hazelnuts and honey with touches of baker's yeast. The medium-bodied palate is uber silky and seamlessly fresh, just spreading its wings and gaining amplitude on the long, savory finish. Give it another year or two in bottle. 200 cases were made.

Relaxed and luxurious, this velvety smooth and super-concentrated wine tastes ultraripe, packed with pastry shop flavors on a luscious texture. We're thinking of a like-to-like pairing, as in sauteed scallops or sole in a beurre blanc. Best through 2028. — Jim Gordon

White tea, herbs and white peaches on the nose. Full-bodied with powerful acidity that carries through the long finish. Floral on the palate with chamomile and lavender coming through. Dense and concentrated. Drink now.

The vineyard designate, the 2018 Chardonnay Ritchie Vineyard is largely in the same mold, although it was brought up in slightly less new oak (25%) and is just a touch lower in alcohol and higher in acidity. Despite those technical details, it's richer and more opulent (which is why you shouldn't judge a wine by numbers) and offers beautiful stone fruits, toasted brioche, honeysuckle, and white flower aromas and flavors. As with the straight Sonoma, it's pure, medium to full-bodied, beautifully balanced, and has a great, great finish. This is another stunningly good Chardonnay from this estate to enjoy over the coming 7-8 years.

From one of the Grand Cru sites in the Russian River, the 2016 Chardonnay Ritchie Vineyard spent 15 months in 30% new French oak. Its vibrant gold color is followed by a ripe, sexy bouquet of white currants, caramelized pineapple, white flowers, and brioche. Bright and juicy on the palate, it has plenty of acidity, good mid-palate depth, and a great finish. It shows the rich, pure, classic style of this vintage beautifully.

This has terrific focus, with an appealingly plump, creamy texture to the lemon curd, tangy makrut lime, green apple and green papaya flavors. Shows details of orange zest, candied ginger and lemon verbena that linger effortlessly on the finish. Drink now through 2028. 150 cases made.

The 2019 Chardonnay Ritchie Vineyard is golden with yellow orchard fruit, savory chamomile, and orange oil. The palate is medium-bodied but has great concentration, with notes of Meyer lemon, yellow apple, and salty earth. There is an autumnal feel to this wine that would go so well with roast chicken dishes with herbes de Provence. Drink it over the coming 6-8 years.

A yellow/straw color, the 2022 Chardonnay Ritchie Vineyard is forward and potent in the glass with notes of scorched earth, resin, peach, and poached citrus. Full-bodied, it’s ripe and showing its more decadent nature on the palate, with lasting notes of oak spice and vanilla. Drink it over the next several years.
Lemon curd, crème fraîche and candied ginger flavors are rich and bold on a smooth, creamy frame, with a fresh thread of acidity. Drink now. 150 cases made.  –MW

A distinctive version, with overt notes of toast, spices and honeysuckle that threaten to overwhelm the core of marmalade and peach preserves. However, a refreshing thread of acidity pulls all the threads together into an appealing, refreshing mix. Drink now. 150 cases made.

\"Graham Family Vineyard\" RRV Pinot Noi.excerpt: Voluptuously full-bodied and generous in supple tannin, this wine is tart in crunchy red fruit, a mix of rhubarb and pomegranate. Plenty of depth and breadth abound, making for a plush, pleasing experience that impresses from beginning to end.

Brimming in dark cherry and baking spice, this wine also reveals underlying bursts of blood orange, tangerine and grapefruit. Lengthy and expansive on the palate, it offers resolved tannins and a smooth, healthy relationship with oak. - Virginie Boone

Buoyant mouthfeel, pillowy and resilient, with a savory aspect. Black plum, sandalwood, and soy sauce extends salinity along with deep base notes of forest floor. The espresso-black cherry finish is long and satisfying.

Dazzling black-cherry aromas and delicious dark plum flavors dance all the way through the finale of this wonderfully choreographed wine. The vividness of the black fruits, the light tanginess of the texture and the length of the finish demand drinking with contemplation. — Jim Gordon

Ripe, round cherry pie aromas waft from the glass of this decadent Russian River Pinot. The palate is bright and laser focused, with a juicy core of raspberry liqueur, orange blossom and zippy tangerine peel before an acid driven finale that lasts well over a minute.

Brisk and brilliant when first poured and right into the next day, this is a wine with energy and concentrated grace. It’s grown by Howard Graham, who planted his Green Valley vineyard on a south-facing slope two decades ago. This is the most compelling wine we’ve tasted yet from David Hejl at Domaine Della. There’s oak influence—in the manner of a grand cru Burgundy, it is present as a structural influence—then the rub of red fruit enters. Corkbuzz’s Amber Rill was one of several panelists who called out the rosewater scents, contributing to the wine’s lasting beauty. The elegant feel of this wine is what stays with me. (200 cases) —J.G

The 2021 Domaine Della Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir is rich and impactful on the palate. This wine shines with aromas and flavors of savory spices, dried earth, black fruits, attractive dusty notes, and complementary oakiness. Enjoy it with stir-fried skirt steak topped with minced shallots.

Pale ruby, the 2019 Pinot Noir Graham Family Vineyard offers very pretty raspberry fruit on the nose, with accents of red and purple flowers and pipe tobacco. The palate is wonderfully perfumed, silky and fresh, and it finishes uplifted with delicate floral notes. 200 cases were made. - Erin Brooks

Bright, fresh and almost piercing notes of cherry and raspberry preserves are streamlined and racy in feel, with a gloss of singed vanilla and red licorice adding some bling to the pinpoint finish. Drink now through 2031. 300 cases made.

Youthful ruby/magenta in hue, the 2022 Pinot Noir Graham Family Vineyard develops complexity on the nose, with notes of rose petals, ripe raspberries, licorice, and fresh rosemary. Medium-bodied, it gains in concentration and length on the palate, revealing ripe tannins, a graceful feel, and notes of earth and incense on the finish. Drink it over the coming 8-10 years.

The 2019 Domaine Della Graham Family Pinot Noir is classic Russian River Valley. This wine shines with aromas and flavors of forest floor, black earth, oak, and licorice. Try it with a grilled, well-marbled ribeye.
Clove, suede and ripe red cherries on the nose. Medium-to full-bodied with a pleasant, guiding minerality and salinity. Integrated tannins. Bright and vibrant on the palate. Drink now.

The 2018 Domaine Della Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir is a wild treat for the palate. This wine is alive, bright, and sassy. Its tight-knit aromas and flavors of ripe strawberries, earth, and black olives would pair nicely with rosemary and black peppercorn-infused lamb kebobs.

Medium ruby, the 2018 Pinot Noir Graham Family Vineyard takes its time to unfurl to smoked cranberries, blood orange, amaro, cola and dried herbs, with more nuance emerging with time in the glass. Medium-bodied, it walks a lovely line of broody fruit and bright amaro character, with a grainy frame and great freshness, finishing long. 200 cases were made.  - Erin Brooks

A juicy, fruity and supple red with raspberries, wild strawberries and some wet stone on the nose. Medium-bodied with silky tannins and bright acidity. Crunchy and playful, with sour cherry character throughout and a juicy, fruity finish. Drink now.

A ripe, flattering style, this is already at its peak, with a core of gently mulled red and black cherry and boysenberry fruit flavors laced with red tea and wood spices. The focused finish lets the fruit shine, with a late echo of sous-bois. Drink now through 2026. 200 cases made.  –JM

The 2019 Pinot Noir Graham Family Vineyard displays classic notes of cherry, licorice, and sassafras, followed by ripeness on the palate, with fine tannins that build to create a more structured wine, with notes of dried earth and cranberry.

On the one hand a Pinot that tends to high ripeness, but, on the other, a wine that boasts a wealth of well-defined fruit that is enriched with creamy oak galore, this fairly full-bodied offering maintains a fine sense of proportion throughout and, even if a touch hot at the finish, never gives way to extremes. It is very well-balanced for the sizeable effort that it is and never once loses sight of the luscious fruit that lies at its core, and, if perhaps, a bit more up-front and not as long-aging as some of the Domaine Della bottlings, it is certain to grow for a half-decade or more.

Bumping up the price, the 2018 Pinot Noir Graham Family Vineyard comes from the Russian River and spent 15 months in 52% new French oak. It's another ripe, powerful effort displaying lots of candied red fruits, violets, and spice notes to go with a medium to full-bodied, upfront, sexy style on the palate. It packs plenty of fruit, stays balanced, and has a great finish. It's not for those craving nuance and elegance, but if you like ripe, sexy Pinot Noir done well, you'll love this.

The 2017 Pinot Noir Graham Family Vineyard is similar to the 2016 with its ripe cherry, strawberry, and floral core, yet it's slightly fresher and more lively, with a beautifully layered, elegant texture. With good acidity, ripe tannins, it's already drinking beautifully yet should easily keep for 7-8 years. This cuvée was brought up for 15 months in 52% new French oak.

Aromas of cherries, forest berries, raspberries, dried leaves and baking spices. It’s medium-bodied with mellow tannins and fresh acidity. Plenty of raspberry character on the palate with a fruity finish. Drink now.
Lots of cedar and juniper berry notes accent the dried red fruit and berry flavors. Offers a lightly spiced finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.  –KM

\"Earl Stephens Vineyard\" RRV Pinot Noi.excerpt: This Della Earl Stephens Vineyard Pinot 2018 is an exceptional experience that sumptuous Pinot enthusiasts are going to adore. The flashy bouquet displays stunning aromas of violets, creme de cassis, cherries, and Christmas spices. A tour de force, this exquisite Pinot Noir flaunts silky waves of dark berries, black plum, oolong tea, cranberry, hints of creamy oak and then culminates in a 40 second finish. Enjoy the thrill ride anytime through 2027+. Decanting recommended prior to 2022.

The 2022 Domaine Della Earl Stevens Vineyard Pinot Noir is long-lasting on the palate. This wine shows aromas and flavors of intense spice box, hints of chalk, and garden herbs. Try it with Thai Lamb Laarb.

The 2021 Domaine Della Earl Stephens Vineyard Pinot Noir shows power, strength, and length on the palate. This wine brings it to the fore with aromas and flavors of sandalwood, spice, oak, and black fruits. Pair it with oven-baked lamb shanks.

Whiffs of pine needles and mint leaves top this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine, as good fruit acidity and snappy red and black cherry flavors make the mouth water. Aged in 55% new French oak, nicely structured and well balanced, it could pair beautifully with a roast duck breast. — Jim Gordon

Spicy and thick in rich, rewarding flavors of baked rhubarb and strawberry spiced by nutmeg, this bold red is also floral in rose petal. Velvety smooth and full bodied in style, it delivers concentrated complexity and undeniable appeal. VIRGINIE BOONE

Ripe cherry, raspberry and kirsch notes form the core, which stays focused and energetic thanks to a spine of acidity running underneath. Singed apple wood and red licorice accents frame the finish as the fruit ripples on. Drink now through 2034. 300 cases made.

A similar youthful ruby red color, the 2022 Pinot Noir Earl Stephens Vineyard is more lifted in the glass, with notes of bright spices, red cherries, beet root, and mint. Medium-bodied, it has more tension through the palate, with bright acidity, a mouthwatering feel, and fine tannins, as well as a lovely orange citrus-noted finish. It’s going to hold up nicely over the coming 10-12 years.

This has aromas of licorice, spice box, dried flowers and red berry fruit. Touch of bergamot and early grey tea. Sensual and beautifully spiced, with a medium to full body, tight tannins, and toasty spice notes coming through on the long finish. Drink or hold.

Juicy red fruit dots a substantial landscape of velvety texture and supple tannin in this richly layered and ripe vineyard-designate. Varietal spice and deep, dark brooding cherry and plum lead the way to a complementary finish of toasted oak and hints of freshness. - Virginie Boone

The 2019 Pinot Noir Earl Stephens Vineyard lends more spiced character, with anise, forest floor, and ripe red cherry. Savory and a bit more structured, it reveals dried herbs, tea leaf, and dried cranberry. Drink it over 2023-2032.
Silky and smooth, with lovely notes of ripe cherry and good balance; elegant and long.

A warm, rich depth of wild strawberry, black cherry, cinnamon and vanilla wrap around a soft, layered and lengthy expression of the variety, offering length and breadth in addition to enduring earthiness. Cardamom and black tea accent the finish contrasted by a twist of tangerine. — Virginie Boone

The 2018 Domaine Della Earl Stephens Vineyard Pinot Noir is authentic and outstanding. This wine shows a complex mix of dried earth, savory spices, and ripe fruit in the aromas and on the palate. Enjoy its enticing presence with mildly-spiced lamb dishes.

The 2018 Pinot Noir Earl Stephens Vineyard offers a touch more complexity in its ripe red and black fruits, sagebrush, tobacco, and spring flower-like aromas and flavors. These all flow to a straight-up gorgeous, opulent Pinot Noir with a silky mouthfeel, polished tannins, and a great, great finish. This is pure Russian River goodness, and while I don't think it's going to make old bones, it will evolve nicely for a solid 4-6 years.

The 2018 Pinot Noir Earl Stephens Vineyard offers pure cranberries, blackberries and rhubarb layered with pipe tobacco, bitter citrus peel, laurel, earth and an amaro-like undercurrent. The palate is nuanced and expressive with bright, bitters character, a grainy frame and great freshness, finishing long. This is great!

The 2017 Pinot Noir Earl Stephens Vineyard comes from a Russian River site and was brought up in 55% new French oak. It has a darker core of fruit, showing notes of tart black cherries, cranberries, damp earth, leafy underbrush, and spring flowers. It's elegant, silky and seamless on the palate, with a beautiful tension and vibrancy in its texture, as well as a great finish.

Well-crafted, succulent and refined, with notes of wild strawberries, crushed raspberries, dried herbs, forest floor and some mild spices. It’s medium-bodied with finely grained tannins and vivid acidity. Vibrant and focused with harmony and poise. Seductive finish. Drink or hold.

The 2019 Domaine Della Earl Stevens Pinot Noir is well-built and lasting on the palate. This wine offers aromas and flavors of ripe red fruit, sandalwood, and licorice. Pair it with oven-oven baked, star-anise accented beef tongue.
Red and blue fruit on the nose with notes of rosemary and violet as well. Full-bodied with silky tannins. Good depth and intensity. A bit of cola pokes through. Well balanced. Drink or hold.

Rich oak jumps to the fore in the nose of this wine but is quickly joined by plenty of ripe cherry and berry-tinged fruit, and the combination of creamy oak and sweet fruit carries on into its comparatively plump and open flavors. While arguably a bit less sophisticated and not quite as layered as some in the Domaine Della collection, it wants for nothing in the way of undisguised richness. Delectable now with fine prospects for a good four or five years of age, it is one to tag for mid-term keeping rather than being buried in a distant nook far back in the cellar.
Pretty aromas of wild strawberries, bark, licorice, fresh herbs and lemon zest. It’s medium- to full-bodied with silky, round tannins. Lovely, spiced flavors on the velvety finish. Drink or hold.

Aromas of deep and rich raspberry jam swirl on the nose of this Russian River Pinot. The softly textured palate displays a balance between bright cherry-berry fruit and dark, savory cinnamon spice before a finish that dances between grippy tannins and lively acidity.

A ripe, flashy style, with singed apple wood, black tea and cinnamon notes infusing a core of succulent black cherry and blackberry fruit flavors. Polished, streamlined finish. For the hedonist crowd. Drink now through 2029. 200 cases made.  –JM

Dark and brooding in style, this red offers sublime layers of black tea, clove and forest. The savory characteristics are met and complemented by rich flecks of cola, dark cherry and caramel, finishing in a soft, supple and plush mix of tannin and oak.

\"Terra de Promissio Vineyard\" SC Pinot.excerpt: Cherries dipped in maple syrup are creamy and dense, followed by milk chocolate cedar. A hint of toast, mint, and white pepper are unique and unfold gracefully thanks to supple tannins and a balanced acid structure.

Aromatic in forest floor, turned earth and stem, this is a rich, full-bodied and softly layered vineyard-designate that is concentrated in dark, brooding notes of berry and plum. Inviting elements of dark chocolate and graham cracker play at the edges before a bright finish emphasizes the wine’s overall balance.

This is a stunning wine from the Petaluma coastal site, with a strong cherry flavor that blends with rose and cherry blossom accents. Strawberry fruit leather joins the offerings on the palate, accenting a seamless, creamy mouthfeel that lingers on the close alongside a baking spice note. - Virginie Boone

Here, again, is an altogether sublime Pinot Noir from Domaine Della that combines fruity richness and impeccable balance. It leads with an intense, wonderfully layered nose of perfectly ripe cherries and mildly toasty oak that shows off the fruity purity and succulence inherent in top-tier Pinots, and, like the best of its cellarmates, it manages to be rich and sophisticated at the same time. It is ripe to be sure, but it wears its ripeness with a considerable sense of grace even now. It is both full and quite lively with an amazingly long finish, and, despite being immensely satisfying at present, can be cellared with complete confidence for eight to ten years.

Moving to the Sonoma Coast, the 2022 Pinot Noir Terra de Promissio Vineyard pours a youthful ruby/magenta color and is fruity and expressive on the nose with aromas of candied flowers, mixed berries, a light touch of blue fruit, and sweet sage. It offers fantastic energy on the palate, with bright, ripe acidity, saline, and balanced ripeness as well as ripe tannins, clean lift, and lasting notes of incense. My favorite in the range, this is a very nicely styled wine to enjoy over the next 15 years.

Seductive, rich fruit flavors are front and center in this pure-tasting, well-balanced wine as it delivers black and red cherries, a touch of sour cherries, tangerine and orange-pekoe tea. Excellent depth and a smooth, lightly tannic texture add to its tempting expression. — Jim Gordon

The 2021 Domaine Della Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir is attractive and multifaceted. This wine excels with aromas and flavors of ripe berries, spices, and wood, with a brightness of tart cherries in the end. Pair it with a savory lamb stew.

The 2019 Pinot Noir Terra De Promissio is elegant and floral on the nose, with ripe strawberry, fresh roses, and cinnamon. This continues on the palate, with pure ripe fruit of candied raspberry, orange zest, and fresh herbs. This is a lovely, well-balanced wine to drink over the coming 8-10 years.

The 2017 Pinot Noir Terra De Promissio saw slightly more new oak than the 2016 and offers more red fruits, as well as lots of toasted spice, crushed flowers, honeysuckle, and smoked earth. It's medium to full-bodied, has a light, graceful texture, beautiful balance, and a beautiful finish. It shows the more fresh, juicy, yet also sunny style of the vintage beautifully. It too will keep for at least 7-8 years.

The 2018 Pinot Noir Terra de Promissio has a nose of cranberry sauce and cherry jam accented by Earl Grey tea, cola, woodsmoke, amaro and underbrush. The medium-bodied palate is packed with nuanced fruits. It has a fine, grainy frame and is super fresh, finishing long and flavorful. This will benefit from another couple of years in bottle. 200 cases were made.

The 2022 Domaine Della "Terra de Promissio" Vineyard Pinot Noir is beautifully complex. This wine shines with aromas and flavors of fragrant spices, dried spices, and mineral notes. Enjoy this wine with braised lamb shanks.

A medium-bodied pinot noir with aromas of crushed raspberries, sliced strawberries, grilled herbs and baking spices. Well composed, with fine tannins and a velvety texture throughout. Elegant with a dense core of delicious berries and a refreshing, bright finish. Drink or hold.

This vineyard, near the town of Petaluma, covers two hillsides with 50 acres of vines facing southwest into the wind gap. The grape skins that ripened in that wind give the wine’s blue fruit a darker tension, what Amber Rill, of NYC’s Corkbuzz Wine Studio, described as “a pretty grip to the tannins.” Fully ripe, the wine delivers fruit sweetness in the service of savor, long, cool and youthfully tight. (200 cases) —J.G.

Punchy and forward, featuring a burst of pomegranate and cherry fruit liberally laced with dried anise and red tea notes. A touch of licorice adds a flattering edge to the juicy finish, but this is more Russian River in profile than Sonoma Coast. Drink now through 2032. 200 cases made.  –JM

The 2019 Domaine Della Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir shows excellent and substantial firmness on the palate. This wine offers  aromas and flavors of black fruit, dried earth, and boysenberries. Try it with grilled bone-in pork chops.

The 2019 Pinot Noir Terra de Promissio has bright scents of raspberries and red cherries with loads of floral nuance and accents of citrus peel. The medium-bodied palate is intensely flavored and seamlessly structured, and it finishes on an uplifted, floral note. It's a very pretty, more delicate style this vintage. 200 cases were made.

Ripe strawberry, rose petal and pine on the nose. Full-bodied with well-integrated tannins. Bright red berries and mint on the palate. Freshness from the pleasant minerality. Melted chocolate and toasted herbs at the soft finish. Drink now.

The 2018 Pinot Noir Terra De Promissio from the Sonoma Coast has a wonderful bouquet of pretty red (and some black) fruits as well as lots of white flower, spice, peppery herbs, and subtle vanilla-laced aromas and flavors. Medium to full-bodied, nicely textured, and elegant on the palate, it has plenty of Sonoma Coast elegance and prettiness while still showing the richer, riper style favored at this address. It's going to keep for 7-8 years nicely.

Red-cherry, blueberry, dried-herb, slate, vanilla and nutmeg aromas. Dried grapefruit zest, too. It’s medium-to full-bodied with sleek, well integrated tannins and crisp acidity. Elegant and refined with a more mineral finish. Drink or hold.

Aromas of sour cherry, mint and fresh-cut flowers dominate the nose of this wine. The juicy, acid-driven palate displays cherry-berry compote, caramel, tangy lemon-orange zest and finally white flowers before the long finish fades.

Cherries, strawberries, cassis and sweet spice aromas. It’s medium-bodied with creamy tannins. Ripe and generous with a juicy core of berries and red fruits coating the palate towards the flavorful finish. Drink now.

The 2015 Pinot Noir Terra de Promissio offers a more peppery, herbal style. Plums, passion fruits, bouquet garni, and bay leaf notes all flow to a medium-bodied, elegant and lively Pinot Noir. It has good acidity, the fresh, elegant style of the vintage, and a great finish. Similar to the Keefer Ranch release, it spent 15 months in 45% new French oak.

Friendly and inviting, with a big burst of raspberry and boysenberry coulis flavors that stretch out nicely alongside notes of black tea, singed wood spice and briar. Shows nice length and definition. Drink now through 2029. 300 cases made.

Richly spiced, with a juicy density to the dried cherry, currant and berry flavors that are backed by firm acidity. The luscious finish has sandalwood accents. Drink now through 2025. 150 cases made.  –KM

\"Soberanes Vineyard\" SLH Pinot Noir.excerpt: This delicious wine is rich, spiced and fruity in dark cherry, with shocks of cardamom and clove that make it instantly interesting. Lengthy and generous, it has a tremendous midpalate, showing great intensity, with an equal amount of length on the finish.

There's a brilliant combination of fresh, juicy raspberry and a struck-stone minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate surrounds a core of juicy strawberry and pomegranate fruit, with ample layers of peppery, thyme and acidity driving it home.

The 2022 Domaine Della Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir is an outstanding wine. This wine excels in aromas and flavors of sandalwood, dried earth, and boysenberries. Serve it with a well-seasoned roast leg of lamb.

The 2021 Domaine Della Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir is bright and alive, with a lasting finish. This wine offers aromas and flavors of chalkiness and ripe berries. Pair it with crispy skin, Cantonese chicken.

A delicious, succulent and silky pinot with notes of sour cherries, wild strawberries, cranberries and warm spices. Medium-bodied with bright acidity and character. Lively and aerial, with good tension and a crunchy finish that shows wild berries and a lift of spices. Drink or hold

Deep and dark black cherry, caramel candy and gingerbread aromas make for a lush and intense nose on this single-vineyard expression, but it manages to also stay bright and zesty. The palate offers a similar range of flavors, from black-cherry compote to ginger snap cookies, proving quite satisfying. — Matt Kettmann

Plummy aromas with notes of vanilla, tobacco and rosemary as well. Full-bodied with well-integrated tannins. Bright and fresh at first, but turns more savory, with chocolate and bark notes coming out more and more. Drink now.

Here is a fairly full-sized Pinot Noir that features strongly stated, decidedly ripe, black cherry fruit with a full complement of crème-brûlée-like oak in tow, and, though its impossible-to-miss richness may not come with quite the same sense of polish shown in its siblings from the North Coast, it is so deep and well-filled that its slight lack of finesse is hardly a sin. It is a fleshy, slightly more muscular take on its variety that is not at all out of keeping with its origin, but it exhibits fine balance nonetheless with a well-measured underpinning of tannin that will see it through to a slightly more rounded maturity some five or six years down the line.

Dark cranberry, light pomegranate, turned earth and a hint of mace aromas show on the dynamic nose of this single-vineyard expression. Ripe cherry and mulberry flavors pop on the ripe sip, yet there are spicy touches of mace and herbal tons of tarragon and rosemary to round it out. — Matt Kettmann

The single vineyard 2018 Pinot Noir Soberanes Vineyard reveals a deeper purple hue and a big, exuberant bouquet of mulled black cherries, roasted herbs, spice, and a touch of cola. Reminding me of a full-bodied Russian River Pinot Noir with its aromatics and texture, it packs plenty of oomph yet stays balanced, textured, and a joy to drink. It's not for the Burgundy-only club, though.

Pretty aromas of blue fruit, violets, bergamot, walnut husk and slate. Dark spices and ground coffee, too. It’s medium-to full-bodied with toned, fine-grained tannins. Intense and focused core of dark fruit, earth and spice. Drink or hold.

Aromas of dark cherries, currants, nutmeg and some herbs. Medium body with velvety tannins and a creamy core of berries and cherries. Mild spices with creamy fruit towards the juicy finish. Drink or hold.

Displaying succulent strawberry and mulberry fruit that's bright and charming in feel, this version is gilded with a touch of red licorice on the sleek finish. Drink now through 2026. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 200 cases made.  –JM

\"4 Amours\" Special Blend SC Pinot Noir.excerpt: This 2018 edition of Della’s best-barrel reserve Pinot is an exceptional experience that sumptuous Pinot enthusiasts are going to adore. The flashy bouquet displays with intense notes of Morello cherries, rhubarb, raspberry pie, and Christmas spices. A tour de force, this exquisite Pinot Noir flaunts silky smooth waves of monumentally delicious dark berries, black plum, oolong tea, cranberry, hints of vanilla oak and then culminates in a 40 second finish. Worthy of 98 points now and well on the path towards 99 points over the next 3 – 5 years. Enjoy through 2027+. Decanting recommended prior to 2024.

Opens with boysenberry and Mediterranean scrub aromas. Savory and spicy, while bright acidity lights it up from within. Clove, red tea, rosemary, Morello cherries, and red beets converge in a maelstrom of flavors. Finishes with a wash of cinnamon toast and wild strawberries.

This is a tour de force of a wine, brooding and burly in the best ways. Rose petal, green tea, cranberry and blueberry all make appearances, layered atop a plush of giving tannin. Complex and slate-y in texture, it finishes in cardamom and clove.
The 2021 Domaine Della 4 Amours Pinot Noir is an out-of-this-world wine. This wine shows aromas and flavors of freshly tilled dirt, black fruits, licorice, and oak. Pair it with BBQ baby back ribs.

The star of an absolutely stunning line-up of lovely Pinots from Domaine Della, this small-lot bottling from four specially chosen barrels is a study in sophistication that is as polished as it is deep in beautifully stated fruit. Both solid and slightly supple and a wine that, albeit amazingly expressive now, is constructed to age famously for a decade or more, it is a tour de force offering of dazzling depth, great reserve and uncommon grace. It is a Pinot that belongs on the shopping lists of fastidious, hard-to-satisfy collectors of the very best California offerings, whatever search that its finding might require.

This special bottling is grippy, complex and intense, exhibiting tense acidity that helps to tame the wild raspberry and cassis flavors. The tannins are seamless yet firm, as well as sizable, while the oak brings accents of baking spice, cola and dried herb. - Virginie Boone

The most expensive Pinot Noir in the lineup, the 2018 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast 4 Amours is a cellar selection of four barrels, with the blend ultimately spending 15 months in 52% new French oak. Lots of framboise, candied cherries, wildflowers, and violet notes all emerge from the glass, and it's beautifully textured and medium to full-bodied, with no hard edges and ripe yet present tannins. Coming all from the Sonoma Coast, this beautiful, powerful Pinot Noir will drink well for 4-6 years.

A deeper shade of magenta, the 2022 Pinot Noir 4 Amours is more introspective and concentrated on opening and slowly starts to reveal itself in the glass with notes of black raspberries, licorice candies, pine, and forest herbs. The palate offers a lovely feel, with even, ripe tannins, harmonious freshness, and a seamless feel with a very ripe finish. It has a lot of charm and is very well done. Drink 2025-2035.

This pretty, polished and elegant wine offers almost-sweet red cherries, strawberries and cinnamon in the nose and ripe but delicate fruits on the palate. Smooth tannins and gentle acidity give it a silky mouthfeel and boost a lingering finish. — Jim Gordon

The 2019 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast 4 Amours has a more rounded appeal on the nose, with soft violets, cedar, and candied strawberry. The palate is true to form, with sweet black raspberry fruit and purple flowers. Drink it over the next 3-6 years, but this is ready to go now.

A four-barrel blend of the vintage, this small-production specialty offering opens in a wealth of high-toned red fruit and citrus. From the bright start it develops velvety richness and savory character on the palate, bursting in black tea, clove, compost and white pepper

The 2019 Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast 4 Amours has a more rounded appeal on the nose, with soft violets, cedar, and candied strawberry. The palate is true to form, with sweet black raspberry fruit and purple flowers. Drink it over the next 3-6 years, but this is ready to go now.

The 2022 Domaine Della 4 Amours Pinot Noir is fully flavored and long-lasting on the palate. This wine exhibits aromas and flavors of smoky, black fruits, and toasty notes. Enjoy it with a thick slice of prime rib.

Velvety, textural and crunchy with aromas of strawberries, red currants, cherries and dried herbs on the nose, followed by a medium body with fresh acidity. Good weight and balance on the palate with bright fruit kicking in toward the refreshing finish. Drink or hold.

*CELLAR SELECTION* Aromas of dusty cherries, fresh-cut flowers, cola and orange peel waft from the glass of this middle-bodied Pinot. The palate holds spicy raspberry compote, cedar and a wealth of drying tannin through the finish. This age-worthy wine will certainly evolve for a decade or more.

The 2019 Domaine Della 4 Amours Pinot Noirs deftly combines power and finesse. This wine excels with aromas and flavors of black fruit, licorice, and oak. Serve it with a grilled Porterhouse steak and minced shallots.

The 2018 Domaine Della 4 Amours Pinot Noir presents a perfect purity of the grape variety. This wine tantalizes the palate with aromas and flavors of ripe red fruit and brisk minerality. Enjoy its lovely and elegant finish with a rosemary-infused, oven-baked rack of lamb.

Wild-raspberry, bramble, clove, dried-earth and potpourri aromas. It’s medium-to full-bodied with sleek, fine tannins and bright acidity. Juicy and flavorful with a rounded, spiced finish. Plenty of fruit. Drink or hold.

Juicy, fruity and velvety with aromas of cherries, strawberries, herbs, chocolate wafers and baking spices. Medium body with velvety tannins. Rich and creamy with an abundance of cherries and strawberries to the finish. Drink now.

Rose of Pinot Noir RRV.excerpt: A bright medium pink color, the 22023 Rose of Pinot Noir is juicy on the nose, with notes of cantaloupe, candied orange, and strawberries. Medium-bodied, it’s straightforward and clean on the palate. It’s going to show its best over the near term.

A deep salmon-pink in the glass, this rosé offers a nose dominated by floral aromas and a whisper of zippy tangerine. The parade of flowers continues on the palate, along with some cantaloupe and white-cherry flavors.

\"Keefer Ranch\" RRV Pinot Noir.excerpt: California bay, black cherries, rose petals, and hints of spice all emerge from the 2015 Pinot Noir RRV Keefer Ranch Vineyard, which comes from a terrific vineyard in the Russian River Valley. Like all the wines here, it's silky and seamless on the palate, with medium-bodied richness, ultra-fine tannin, and a great finish. Aged 15 months in 45% new French oak, it’s going to keep for a decade or more.
